summary: Documentation doesn't clearly indicate when TypeScript SDK methods have multiple overloads. Users struggle to discover alternative function signatures because overloads aren't visually distinguished or listed together.
userImpact: Users may miss available method signatures and overloads, leading to incomplete understanding of the API capabilities and potentially implementing less optimal solutions.
proposedFix: Add visual distinction for overloaded methods and display a list of all available overload signatures under the method header with links to each variant's detailed documentation.
keyQuote: Some visual change, and maybe a list of options (preferably linked) under the header
